intro: Talisia firma, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its small, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Talisia firma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for gardens in tropical and subtropical climates.
